pr_title: Implement equals and hashCode in BrooklinMetricInfo.

timeline.message:
Merge pull request #1 from linkedin/master

Pull latest
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:linkedin/brooklin into HEAD
Add equals and hashCode in BrooklinMetricInfo

timeline.author: somandal

timeline.author: ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText: If you think it's a nicer choice, some JDK methods (e.g. Objects.equals()) use a and b in situations like this.
timeline.author: ahmedahamid
ahmedahamid
ahmedahamid
ahmedahamid
ahmedahamid
ahmedahamid

timeline.bodyText:
It would be great to assert for identical hashCode() values whenever we assertEquals(); this ensures we honor this part of the hashCode() contract:
If two objects are equal according to the equals(Object) method, then calling 
the hashCode method on each of the two objects must produce the same integer result.
timeline.author: ahmedahamid

replies.bodyText: Good catch. There was a bug in hash code. Adding this helped in fixing it.
replies.author: vmaheshw
